greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Number of compositions of n in which no part is unique (every part appears at least twice).
reference: S. Heubach and T. Mansour, Combinatorics of Compositions and Words, Chapman and Hall, 2009.
link: Alois P. Heinz and Vaclav Kotesovec, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..2100 (first 500 terms from Alois P. Heinz)
maple: b:= proc(n, i, t) option remember; `if`(n=0, t!, `if`(i<1, 0,
mathematica: b[n_, i_, t_] := b[n, i, t] = If[n == 0, t!, If[i < 1, 0, b[n, i - 1, t] + Sum[b[n - i*j, i - 1, t + j]/j!, {j, 2, n/i}]]]; a[n_] := b[n, n, 0]; Table[a[n], {n, 0, 40}] (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Aug 29 2016, after _Alois P. Heinz_ *)
results.author: _Geoffrey Critzer_, Mar 31 2014
ext: More terms from _Alois P. Heinz_, Mar 31 2014
